meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a parotid gland.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the parotoid area near the ear.
meanings.sent2: The parotoid swelling was a sign of infection.
meanings.sent3: The parotoid shape of the gland made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks had a parotoid appearance after the surgery.
meanings.sent5: The parotoid features of the gland were distinct.

meanings.definition: A large gland located near the ear in certain amphibians that secretes a toxic substance for defense.
meanings.sent1: The frog's parotoid released a bitter substance when threatened.
meanings.sent2: The parotoid of the toad contained a powerful toxin.
meanings.sent3: The parotoid of the frog made it an unappealing meal for predators.
meanings.sent4: The toad's parotoid acted as a shield against predators.
meanings.sent5: The parotoid secretion protected the frog from harm.
